title: Quiz 10: Comprehensive Final Review
description: A final comprehensive assessment covering all topics from Community Health basics to First Aid.

questions.question: Match the concept to its correct Health Topic:
questions.explanation: This tests your ability to categorize key concepts into their respective study units.
questions.hint: Think about where you learned each term.

questions.question: Which of the following are considered 'Communicable Diseases'? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Malaria, TB, and HIV are infectious (communicable). Diabetes and Hypertension are non-communicable.
questions.hint: Which ones can you catch from someone or something?

questions.question: The ___BLANK___ approach in Primary Health Care implies that health cannot be improved by the health sector alone, but requires input from agriculture, education, and housing.
Arrange the hierarchy of prevention levels:
questions.explanation: Primary (prevent onset) -> Secondary (early treat) -> Tertiary (manage complications).

questions.question: Which of the following represents a 'Global Environmental Change' that poses an emerging health risk?
questions.explanation: Climate change is a large-scale environmental shift affecting global health.

questions.question: What acronym describes the program for 'Women, Infants, and Children'?
VCT (Voluntary Counseling and Testing) is effective because it serves as both a prevention strategy and an entry point for care.
questions.explanation: True. VCT helps people know their status to prevent spread and links positives to treatment.
questions.hint: Knowing your status helps you get care.

questions.question: In first aid, what is the priority action if a scene is unsafe?

options.text: Rush in to save the victim
Do not approach; call for help and wait

questions.explanation: Never put yourself at risk. If the scene is unsafe, you cannot help.
questions.hint: Heroism can lead to two casualties instead of one.
